Relationships Package¶

Submodules¶

relationships_utils.causal_inference module¶

Causal Inference¶

This module provides functions for performing causal inference analysis, including Granger causality tests.

relationships_utils.causal_inference.granger_causality_test(x, y, max_lag=12)[source]¶

Perform Granger causality test to determine if one time series can predict another.

Parameters:

  • x (pd.Series) – Time series data for the first variable.

  • y (pd.Series) – Time series data for the second variable.

  • max_lag (int) – Maximum lag to test for causality (default is 12).

Returns:

Granger causality test results, with lags as keys and test results as values.

Return type:

dict

relationships_utils.clustering module¶

Clustering¶

This module provides functions for clustering analysis.

relationships_utils.clustering.kmeans_clustering(data, n_clusters)[source]¶

Perform KMeans clustering on the given data.

Parameters: data (array-like): The input data for clustering. n_clusters (int): The number of clusters.

Returns: array: The cluster labels for each data point.

relationships_utils.correlation_analysis module¶

Correlation Analysis¶

This module provides functions for analyzing correlations between variables.

relationships_utils.correlation_analysis.pearson_correlation(x, y)[source]¶

Calculate the Pearson correlation coefficient between two variables.

Parameters: x (array-like): The first variable. y (array-like): The second variable.

Returns: float: The Pearson correlation coefficient.

relationships_utils.correlation_analysis.spearman_correlation(x, y)[source]¶

Calculate the Spearman rank correlation coefficient between two variables.

Parameters: x (array-like): The first variable. y (array-like): The second variable.

Returns: float: The Spearman rank correlation coefficient.

relationships_utils.network_analysis module¶

This module provides tools for performing network analysis. It includes functions to create and analyze network graphs, calculate network metrics, and visualize connections.

relationships_utils.network_analysis.build_metric_network(metrics, connections)[source]¶

Build a network of metrics.

Parameters:

  • metrics – List of metrics.

  • connections – List of connections between metrics.

Returns:

NetworkX graph representing the metric network.

Return type:

G

relationships_utils.network_analysis.centrality_measures(network)[source]¶

Calculate centrality measures for the network.

Parameters:

network – NetworkX graph representing the metric network.

Returns:

Dictionary of centrality measures.

Return type:

centrality

relationships_utils.recommender_systems module¶

Recommender Systems¶

This module provides functions for building and evaluating recommender systems.

relationships_utils.recommender_systems.recommend_items(data, item_id, n_recommendations)[source]¶

Recommend items similar to the given item based on nearest neighbors.

Parameters: data (array-like): The input data for recommendation. item_id (int): The ID of the item to base the recommendations on. n_recommendations (int): The number of recommendations to generate.

Returns: array: The IDs of the recommended items.

metricMapAPI
